metadata.description: Important intermediate verbs - emotions, cognition, and complex actions

present.spanish: Me lavo las manos antes de cada comida.
present.english: I wash my hands before every meal.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Se lavan las manos frecuentemente en la casa.
present.english: They wash their hands frequently at the house.
present.subject: ellas

preterite.spanish: Me lavé las manos inmediatamente después del accidente.
preterite.english: I washed my hands immediately after the accident.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te lavaste el pelo con el nuevo champú.
preterite.english: You (informal) washed your hair with the new shampoo.
preterite.subject: tú

future.spanish: Se lavará las manos antes del trabajo.
future.english: He will wash his hands before work.
future.subject: él

future.spanish: Se lavará las manos antes del trabajo.
future.english: She will wash her hands before work.
future.subject: ella

present.spanish: Te quedas a dormir en casa de tu abuela.
present.english: You (vos) stay to sleep at your grandmother's house.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Ustedes se quedan en casa cuando llueve mucho.
present.english: You all (vosotros) stay home when it rains a lot.
present.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Me quedé dormido durante la película aburrida.
preterite.english: I fell asleep during the boring movie.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se quedó en la biblioteca hasta que cerró.
preterite.english: He stayed at the library until it closed.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Me quedaré en casa para estudiar este fin de semana.
future.english: I will stay home to study this weekend.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te quedarás sorprendido con los resultados.
future.english: You (informal) will be surprised with the results.
future.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me voy a casa después del trabajo.
present.english: I'm leaving for home after work.
present.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se fue de casa a los dieciocho años.
preterite.english: He left home at eighteen years old.
preterite.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Me fui ayer.
preterite.english: I left yesterday.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se fue sin decir adiós.
preterite.english: He left without saying goodbye.
preterite.subject: él

present-progressive.spanish: Estoy yéndome a casa después del trabajo.
present-progressive.english: I'm leaving for home after work.
present-progressive.subject: yo

present-progressive.spanish: Está yéndose del país por motivos de trabajo.
present-progressive.english: He is leaving the country for work reasons.
present-progressive.subject: él

going-to.spanish: Voy a irme a casa después del trabajo.
going-to.english: I'm leaving for home after work.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.spanish: Va a irse del país por motivos de trabajo.
going-to.english: He is going to leave the country for work reasons.
going-to.subject: él

going-to.english: I am going to leave tomorrow.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to leave alone.
going-to.subject: tú

present-perfect.spanish: Me he ido a casa después del trabajo.
present-perfect.english: I have left for home after work.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: Se ha ido del país por motivos de trabajo.
present-perfect.english: He has left the country for work reasons.
present-perfect.subject: él

present.spanish: Me pongo nervioso antes de los exámenes.
present.subject: yo

present.english: You (vos) get cheerful when it rains.
present.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Me puse furioso cuando escuché la noticia.
preterite.english: I got furious when I heard the news.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se puso enfermo después de comer mariscos.
preterite.english: He got sick after eating seafood.

preterite.english: I put on the hat.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se puso enfermo.
preterite.english: He got sick.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Me pondré el traje nuevo para la graduación.
future.english: I will put on the new suit for graduation.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te pondrás muy feliz cuando veas el regalo.
future.english: You (informal) will get very happy when you (informal) see the gift.
future.subject: tú

present-progressive.english: I am putting on my shoes.
present-progressive.subject: yo

going-to.spanish: Me voy a poner el abrigo.
going-to.english: I am going to put on the coat.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to get happy.
going-to.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me siento muy cómodo en esta casa.
present.english: I feel very comfortable in this house.

present.spanish: Nos sentimos muy unidos como familia.
present.english: We feel very united as a family.

preterite.spanish: Te sentiste como en casa desde el primer día.
preterite.english: You (vos) felt at home from the first day.

preterite.english: I felt very excited during the ceremony.

preterite.english: I felt sad.

preterite.spanish: Se sintió confundido.
preterite.english: He felt confused.

future.spanish: Te sentirás como en casa en tu nuevo trabajo.
future.english: You (vos) will feel at home in your new job.

future.spanish: Nos sentiremos muy felices en nuestra nueva casa.
future.english: We will feel very happy in our new house.
future.subject: nosotros

going-to.english: I am going to feel proud.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to feel relieved.
going-to.subject: tú

present.spanish: Piensa que el trabajo va a funcionar.
present.english: He thinks the work is going to work.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Pensó en su familia durante todo el viaje.
preterite.english: He thought about his family during the entire trip.
preterite.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Pensó en su familia durante todo el viaje.
preterite.english: She thought about her family during the entire trip.
preterite.subject: ella

preterite.spanish: Pensé en llamarte.
preterite.english: I thought about calling you.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Pensó en su familia.
preterite.english: He thought about his family.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Pensarás diferente cuando tengas más tiempo.
future.english: You (informal) will think differently when you (informal) have more time.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Pensarán que estamos locos por este trabajo.
future.english: They will think we're crazy for this work.
future.subject: ellos

present-progressive.english: I am thinking about the problem.
present-progressive.subject: yo

going-to.english: What are you (informal) going to think of me?
going-to.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Voy a pensar en tu propuesta.
going-to.english: I am going to think about your proposal.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to think differently.
going-to.subject: tú

present-perfect.spanish: He pensado en cambiar de trabajo.
present-perfect.english: I have thought about changing jobs.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present.spanish: Entiendes el español mejor que yo.
present.english: You (informal) understand Spanish better than me.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Entiendes perfectamente lo que te digo.
present.english: You (vos) understand perfectly what I'm telling you (vos).
present.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Entendieron la importancia del trabajo.
preterite.english: You all (vosotros) understood the importance of the work.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Entendí el problema después de leer el manual.
preterite.english: I understood the problem after reading the manual.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Entendí la explicación.
preterite.english: I understood the explanation.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Entendió el mensaje.
preterite.english: He understood the message.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Entenderé mejor el idioma después de vivir allí.
future.english: I will understand the language better after living there.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Entenderás la situación cuando seas padre.
future.english: You (informal) will understand the situation when you (informal) become a father.
future.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Vas a entender cuando seas mayor.
going-to.english: You (informal)'re going to understand when you (informal)'re older.
going-to.subject: tú

going-to.english: I am going to understand everything.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to understand soon.
going-to.subject: tú

present.english: I feel very cold in winter.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Sientes la música en el alma.
present.english: You (informal) feel the music in your soul.
present.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Sentí una gran emoción al ver a mi familia.
preterite.english: I felt great emotion when I saw my family.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Sintió alivio cuando terminó el examen final.
preterite.english: He felt relief when the final exam ended.

preterite.spanish: Sentí una vibración.
preterite.english: I felt a vibration.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Sintió miedo.
preterite.english: He felt fear.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Sentiré mucha alegría cuando me gradúe.
future.english: I will feel great joy when I graduate.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Sentirás la diferencia después de la ayuda.
future.english: You (informal) will feel the difference after the help.
future.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Te vas a sentir mucho mejor.
going-to.english: You (informal)'re going to feel much better.
going-to.subject: tú

going-to.english: I am going to feel nostalgia.

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to feel relief.

present.spanish: Vengo de la escuela en autobús.
present.english: I come from the school by bus.

present.spanish: Vienes a casa para el almuerzo.

preterite.english: I came by taxi.

preterite.spanish: Vino sin avisar.
preterite.english: He came without warning.

future.spanish: Vendré a visitarte en cuanto tenga tiempo libre.
future.english: I will come visit you as soon as I have free time.

future.english: We will come have dinner at your house on Sunday.

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to come to the party.

present-perfect.english: He has come from far away.

present.spanish: Ponen mucho esfuerzo en su trabajo.

present.spanish: La niña se ducha en la mañana.

quality.fix_issue: Not reflexive (but context says DUCHARSE) + missing translation
